data.name: Any%
data.rules:
General Timing Rules:

**Time begins** on the first frame where Astro is visible on his speeder after fading in from black.

**Time ends** on the first frame where the *main ending* platform turns blue after Astro lands on it **OR** for levels without an ending platform, time ends on the first frame where the flash created by the speeder going into the distance is no longer visible.

*Runs must be completed on the replay version of a level (where certain "story" bots are replaced with silver coins) unless stated otherwise.*

***Warp exits do not count as a completed run, you must end on the main exit.***

data.name: Any%
data.rules:
**Time begins** on clicking x to start a new save file (first frame of the memory card moving).

**Time ends** on the final hit against the boss (when the center of the UFO changes from orange-ish to pink).

You may exit your game save if needed, however you may not exit/close the game entirely. The use of activity cards is not permitted, this includes both popup cards and main menu cards. 

*You may not collect the 4 Astro's Playroom crossover bots found under rocks in the crash site as a method of getting to the 200 bot goal to unlock the final boss.*

Specifically all collectibles. This includes collecting all 169 gatcha items, rescuing all 301 base game bots, collecting all 120 puzzle pieces, all gold crown flags, and 14 special bots found in eggs around the crash site and safari park. **You must have 8 crowns on the galaxy map** and 169 bots (excluding the playroom bots) in the Pocketstation's VIP bot list in the crash site**.**

**Time begins** on clicking x to start a new save file (first frame of the memory card moving).

**Time ends** upon whichever of the following event occurs last:

1. Collection of the master bot (the first frame of the bot reacting to being hit)
2. Collection of the 169th gatcha collectable (the first frame of the gatcha counter showing 169/169)
3. Collection of the last special bot found in eggs around the crash site (first frame of the egg being hit)

You may exit your game save if needed, however you may not exit/close the game entirely unless it is an unintended crash *(time taken to re-enter the game after a crash is included in your time and must be shown).*

*You may not collect the 4 Astro's Playroom crossover bots found under rocks in the crash site as a method of getting to any threshold of bots to perform an action or unlock a boss; for instance, collection of one of these bots will mean you must get one bot more than the amount required to do a task from that moment onwards, and so on.*

You must play on the standard edition of the game. If you own the digital deluxe edition, playing on a different account from where you originally bought the game will let you play on the standard edition.

data.name: Challenge Level Gauntlet
data.rules:
*Runs must be completed on the replay version of a level (where certain "story" bots are replaced with silver coins) except for Great Master Challenge, where you may have the bot present instead of the coin.*

**You may choose which order to do the challenge levels, but must end with Great Master Challenge.**

**Time starts** upon on the first frame where Astro is visible on his speeder after entering the first level.

**Time ends** upon the first frame Astro collects the coin or punches the bot at the end of the great master challenge.

**Requirements:**

**YOU MUST complete all of the following levels:**

- Cut 'N Grind
- Pumpkin Peril
- Dashing Dillo
- Fragile Frenzy
- Rolling Rampage
- Swinging Sentries
- Magnetic Mayhem
- Ropeway Rally
- Follow the Light
- Vertical Velocity
- Boing! Bonanza
- Splashing Sprint
- To the Beat
- Slowdown Showdown
- Shocking Behaviour
- Birdy Barrage
- Great Master Challenge

data.name: Space Bully Nebulax
data.rules:
LEVEL SPECIFIC TIMING RULES:

**Time begins** on the first frame where Astro and his speeder are visible (may be on your first attempt or after a restart)

**Time ends** at the final hit against the boss (when the center of the UFO changes from orange-ish to pink)

data.name: Credits Clash
data.rules:
LEVEL SPECIFIC TIMING RULES:

**Time begins** on the first frame of glitchy text appearing on the screen.

**Time ends** on the last frame where the flash created by the speeder going into the distance is visible.

data.name: Great Master Challenge
data.rules:
LEVEL SPECIFIC TIMING RULES:

*This level may be done on a first attempt where the bot is present at the end.*

**Time begins** as you're spawning into the level, on the first frame after Astro's model pops in with a flash and changes from a voxel model to a regular model with pixels overlaid on top of it. If you are wearing a costume this is the first frame where the costume is visible, since the costumes don't pixelate. *(because of the way the level works, to start a new run you may play through from your first entrance from the portal or die/restart after already being in the level).*

**Time ends** upon the first frame Astro collects the coin or punches the bot at the end of the level.
